channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2024050307
item.description:
Report E-2024050307

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-17T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-14
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XTO experienced a UN1760 Extreme 184 release from (15) 5-gallon bladder boxes. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the concrete dock floor and a 10’ x 4’ area of the wood trailer floor due to improper loading. The damaged boxes of products were placed into (2) 55-gallon poly drums and an 85-gallon poly drum. The impacted absorbents and neutralizer used to clean the release were placed into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024050321
item.description:
Report E-2024050321

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-17T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-14
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCN experienced a UN2672 Steammate NA1324 release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons of product released to a 23' x 8' area of the trailer floor and a 25' x 10' area of the concrete lot below. The release was caused by the tote falling on its side as a result of improper loading. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbent and vinegar were deployed and worked into the impacted areas to clean and neutralize the release. The impacted absorbents were containerized into (4) 55-gallon poly drums. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized into a cubic yard box. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024050624
item.description:
Report X-2024050624

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-17T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-12
  • City: BOISE
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Doug Olsen Road Driver stated that he noticed a leak from trailer 89562 when he stopped to use the restroom at a truck stop. Doug stated that there was a smell coming from the trailer but did not see any leak. Doug was advised by safety anytime there is a smell or a spill, Safety is to to called imm ediately Doug stated he called his dispatch to direct him to SC 143 to have the smell coming from the trailer looked at. Doug stated when he arrived at SC143 he saw where something started to leak out of the trailer on to the ground. Doug stated it looked to be 10oz on the payment of the parking lot and some on the rear bumper of the trailer. Doug opened the trailer doors up and stated the smell was so strong that he had to walk away from the trailer to clean air. Doug stated he does think it is a Hazmat on the trail that is leaking do to the smell coming from the trailer. CURA was called to a ssist with the spill.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 8, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of cleaning compound was punctured in transit and released approximately 55-gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from TPM Group (TPM) to remediate the impacted site. TPM personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer and pavement and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged drum of product was placed into one (1) 95-gallon drum.

  • Description: PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING LIQUID. OUTER CARTON HAD NO HAZARD MARKINGS. RESPONDER PUT PACKAGE UPRIGHT INTO A SPILL TRAY AND ABSORBED SPILT LIQUID WITH ZEP ZORBENT AND CLAY ABSORBENT. PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND FOUND TO CONTAIN A GALLON BUCKET MARKED WITH A CLASS 3 FLAMMABLE LIQUID DIAMOND AND UN1993(HEPTANE). PACKAGE ALSO CONAINED 3 AEROSOL CANS. CAP OF BUCKET WAS DEFECTIVE WHICH CAUSED LIQUID TO LEAK.

item.title: Report X-2024050580
item.description:
Report X-2024050580

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-17T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-13
  • City: GEISMAR
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 16500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 13, 2024 at approximately 22:30 CDT during switching operations on the south end of the CN Geismar Yard, a CN transportation crew member observed vapors emitting from the top of tank car RCRX 2718 (Load / Hydrochloric Acid / UN 1789 / PG II / UN 1789). The CN Dangerous Goods Officer was notified of the incident and responded to the rail yard to investigate. The DGO inspection revealed a small amount of liquid pooled in the bowl of the external spring safety relief valve. The liquid was emitting vapors and tested as 1-2 PH indicating the liquid was corrosive coinciding with the lading. All service equipment fittings and closures were found to be properly secured. The product pooled in the bowl of the SRV was absorbed with a chemical pad. The SRV was bubble leak tested externally and was found to be leak free. The shipper of record was notified of the incident. A qualified mobile repair unit will replace the SRV on-site and re-qualify the tank car prior to continuing in transportation. The removed SRV will be sent to the manufacturer for a bench test.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LLA experienced a UN1263 RailPlex 2.0 Alkyd Primer release from (5) 5-gallon metal pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-quarts of product released to a 10’ x 3’ area of the trailer floor due to a loading strap bending the pails. The damaged pails were collected into an 85-gallon metal drum. Absorbents were then deployed to clean the impacted area and then collected along with the broken pallet pieces into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 17000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a product leak at an XPO drop lot. A Contractor determined that the release stemmed from a pinhole size puncture as a result of improper loading on a 55-gallon metal drum. The exterior of the drum appeared damaged by friction with another drum causing the puncture. The drum contained the product, ‘Lemon Sage Fragrance’. The release was approximately 1-gallon and impacted the wooden trailer floor in an 8’x6’ area. The Contractor cleaned-up the release with absorbent rags and overpacked the damaged drum. One drum of waste was generated from this incident. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.

  • Description: , Clean Harbors Environmental Services Inc. was contracted to perform the cleanup.Upon arrival on site, Clean Harbors Environmental Services Inc. met with Lake County Hazmat Team. The intermodal container was inspected, and one 55-gallon drum was detected at nose of trailer, which had tipped, resulting in the loss of approximately 1 gallon of free product. Free product was contained to container floor and asphalt beneath. Clean Harbors Environmental Services applied a neutralizer agent to the affected asphalt surface, and the free product on the container floor, which was swept up and placed into one 55-gallon drum, along with cleanup debris. The intermodal container was offloaded, damaged drum was overpacked, and container floor was cleaned. Thete were no injuries or exposures reported.

  • Description: A passenger had a vape pin in his bag under the seat which exploded near the top of climb at approximately FL300. This produced debris, smoke, and fumes and caused the flight attendants to use a halon bottle on it. The flight attendants reported this to the pilots who declared an emergency and turned back towards RNO. Once the situation was determined to be under control and there was no fire the pilots advised ATC that they no longer wanted to declare an emergency. There were no injuries. Aircraft Maintenance conducted inspections and the a/c was placed back in service. Dave Evans-SWA PHI and Fred Brown FAA Field Inspector SMF Region are aware. Pictures and details have been pr6vided to them.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 16, 2024, at 19:33, Tank Car IAPX 1141 was observed, during a roll-by inspection, as actively emitting vapor from the top discharge stack. Upon investigation, the vapor valve handle located in the A-R cabinet was found to be slightly opened, with secondary closure turnbuckles and zip ties broken loose from the valve handle. The valve was closed and spare turnbuckles and zip ties (found in the cabinet) were re-applied to the valve for secondary securement. Estimated duration of the release was undeterminable, the vapor valve and associated piping was found frosted.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 15th, 2024, at 11:47 hours, personnel in the CSXT Radnor Yard in Nashville, Tennessee, reported GATX65584, a residue tank car of Sulfur, molten, was suspected to be leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, PCS Sales, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #20240408-00072). Marion Environmental, Inc. (MEI), a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found a vapor release due to a hole in the tank shell nozzle. MEI personnel cleaned and purged the tank car to remove all hazardous residue. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Matt Paynter, Matt.paynter@nutrien.com, 706-564-8118). It was subsequently determined that repair costs exceeded car value; tank car will be cut for scrap on location.

item.title: Report I-2024050027
item.description:
Report I-2024050027

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-16T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-12
  • City: Westlake
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: THE KANSAS CITY SOUTHERN RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0140 on 4/12/24 it was reported that empty Ammonia Solution car GATX 71080 was making a venting/hissing noise while in the CPKC Mossville rail yard. CPKC Hazmat mobilized a railroad qualified response contractor to investigate and mitigate the release. Upon arrival, responders determined the tank car had 80psi of pressure within. Further inspection revealed that the Kelso re-closing pressure relief device(PRD), with a setting of 165psi, was the source of the leak and could not be repaired in the field. The pressure on the tank car was reduced by sparging the vapors through water to scrub the ammonia vapors until Opsi in GATX 71080 was met. Wet towels were placed around the PRD and a plastic bag was used around the towels to absorb any Ammonia vapors that might have been released. The car was subsequently purged and cleaned, and the shipper procured an OTMA-1 to move the car to home shop for repairs. File Note: Item 19-the quantity released was estimated based on the best information available at the time of filing. This shipment was offered as a'bulk' shipment, aka one car load, therefore the exact amount offered in this package is not known to the carrier. This carrier does not have access to mass balance data which can exactly quantify this value.

item.title: Report E-2024040333
item.description:
Report E-2024040333

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-16T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-11
  • City: AVON
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 55000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 04/11/2024, at 1408 hours, personnel in the CSXT Avon, Indiana Yard reported CTCX 735942, a loaded tank car of Styrene Monomer, Stabilized, leaking from the bottom of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Americas Styrenics, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report # 2024-0411-00185). HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the car leaking from the bottom outlet valve (BOV). HEPACO personnel found that despite the operating handle of the BOV being in the closed position, the valve was partially open; additionally, it was determined that the BOV cap gasket was worn and deteriorated. HEPACO personnel fully closed the valve and replaced the BOV cap gasket. Because the BOV was determined to be faulty or out of adjustment, contractor personnel transferred the contents of the load on-site prior to forwarding in transportation. Subsequent forwarding of the non-conforming car to shop for repair was authorized by OTMA. The issues identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Vince Woolridge, 281-825-9424).

  • City: Atlanta

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: PVS Transportation driver was scheduled to deliver a shipment of Sodium Bi Sulfite to City of Atlanta. Once the driver arrived on site he proceeded to the unloading location and met with the onsite representative. The onsite representative directed the driver to hook up to tank#1 connection. The driver hooked up to the unloading connection and proceeded to make the delivery. During the delivery the driver the driver was standing outside near his trailer connection and noticed a sound that didn' t represent offload and went to investigate. Upon investigation the driver noticed the unloading line wasn' t connected to the tank and the driver proceeded back to his truck to shut off the product flow. Approximately 300 gallons of Sodium Bisulfite was released into containment.

  • Description: XPO-LOGISTICS contacted ERTS regarding a leaking lid on a 55-gallon poly drum containing SaniDate 5.0. The lid appeared to be not sealed tight enough or not sealed correctly. This resulted in an estimated 1-cup release of product onto the top of the poly drum, the plastic shrink-wrap, and cardboard. A Contractor removed the impacted plastic shrink wrap and cardboard and submerged them in water. The leaking drum was overpacked into a 95-gallon DF. In total, 2 drums of waste were generated for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.

item.title: Report I-2024040026
item.description:
Report I-2024040026

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-15T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-01
  • City: Albuquerque
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: BREEZE AIRWAYS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Friday March 1, 2024, N2278Z was operating from LAX to PIT. During the cruise phase of flight, a passenger's charging device(identified as a Cobra CPP8000 external lithium ion battery pack) began to smoke as a lithium battery runaway situation developed. The device was initially located within the passenger's carry-on backpack underneath the seat in front of them. Upon noticing the smoke, the passenger reached into their backpack for the battery pack and received second degree bums to their hands. The Inflight crew in partnership with a deadheading Breeze Captain suppressed the smoking device with water and utilized the onboard PED kit to contain the device. The flight diverted to KABQ out of an abundance of caution where it landed safely and was met by fire/EMS upon arrival at the gate. No evacuation was required and passengers were deplaned normally. The passenger who received burns was treated at the scene by EMS and released.

  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/04/2024 Veolia employees were unloading a cubic yard box into a trailer at the 10-Day transfer area in Veolia, South Windsor, CT facility when an employee noticed a few drops of liquid coming out of a cubic yard box. Only a couple of drops were observed under the cubic yard box. The employees noticed the leak right away and quickly put down some spill pads to contain the leak. Employees proceeded to open the container and observed many inner paint related material containers were dented or leaking inside the cubic yard box. Employees righted the inner containers, poured absorbent into the cubic yard box to prevent any further leaks, and transported the container to the ultimate disposal facility.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UDV experienced a battery acid release from a 2113-pound battery. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of battery acid released to a 6’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor and a 30’ x 2’ area of the concrete lot below due to improper loading; the battery fell over in transit. Absorbents and soda ash were worked into the impacted areas to clean and neutralize the release. All impacted absorbents, pallet pieces, and debris were then collected into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The damaged battery was up righted and secured to a pallet. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Manager Robinson called the shipper and told them to get an OTMA because the car leaked below the valve body.

item.title: Report E-2024050192
item.description:
Report E-2024050192

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-01
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 1, 2024, at 1917 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Romeoville, Illinois regarding the release of approximately (1) gallon of Magnum K (UN3266, 8, II) from (1) 55-gallon poly drum. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release was caused by a puncture to the drum and contained to a small area of the dock floor under the pallet. Terminal personnel placed absorbents on the release prior to the contractor’s arrival. Contractors placed the damaged drum containing product in a 95-gallon plastic overpack. Contractors then neutralized and collected the spent absorbents with the proper PPE. All waste generated was placed in (1) 55-gallon DF, and (1) 95-gallon overpack DF and staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

  • City: CONLEY
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 24, 2024, at 0858 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Conley, Georgia regarding the release of a total of 2 gallons of Muriatic Acid (UN1789, 8, II) from (15) 1-gallon poly jugs. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release was caused by the cargo being improperly loaded and was contained to a small area of the trailer floor, a 15ft x 3ft area of the concrete dock, multiple areas of asphalt and it also impacted a tire. Contractors were able to neutralize the release then clean the release with absorbents, and the proper PPE. All waste generated was placed in (3) 55-gallon DF’s and was staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050210
item.description:
Report E-2024050210

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-19
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A third party hauler was hooking onto a Veolia's outbound trailer. When the trailer made contact with the king pin, a yellow liquid began to drop slowly out of the trailer, just behind the tractor. The driver was instructed to pull away from the van. A Veolia employee then went to grab a bag of solid absorb and placed it below the leak. Approximately 4oz of the liquid was spilled onto the cement floor before it stopped. The trailer was then unloaded. During this time, the employees noticed that 3 drums were leaking from their bottom and sides. The bottom of the drums were corroded which caused pinholes on the bottom portion of the body of the drums. Employees then overpacked the 3 drums into poly containers. Approximately 4 oz of the liquid was released onto the trailer's floor. These 3 drums were profiled as a solid by the vendor. Possible misclassification of the waste along with improper packaging may have caused the leak. All three drums were placed into a poly 85 salvage drum. The manifest was then rejected back to the broker, and the broker came back to pick up their drums.

item.title: Report E-2024050159
item.description:
Report E-2024050159

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-09
  • City: Grafton
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Ross Transportation Services, Inc. (RTS)
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At about 17:30, a woman called RTS stating that she was following a tanker pulled by an RTS truck on RT 83 and residual material from the tanker had splashed onto her car (a red crossover Mercedes-Benz). RTS was transporting a tanker from American Woodmark Corp. and had dropped the tanker in its transfer line. Records indicate the driver had noted a faulty seal at the top of the tanker on his post trip inspection. Investigation confirmed that the grey material that had splashed down the side of the tanker, as well as on the ground from the manhole overflow tube appeared similar to the specks splashed on the car. No material was on the roadway. The spill in the transfer line was cleaned up, and a reportable spill report filed. The citizen arrived on site to show us the material on her car, which were small droplets of grey material. The gasket/seal has been replaced.
